mc.name: Aladdin's Lamp
mc.oracleText: {X}, {T}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead look at the top X cards of your library, shuffle all but one of them, put the shuffled cards on the bottom of your library, then draw a card. X can't be 0.
mc.printedText: {X}, {T}: Instead of drawing a card from the top of your library, draw X cards but choose only one to put in your hand. You must shuffle the leftover cards and put them at the bottom of your library.

mc.name: Aladdin's Ring
mc.oracleText: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
mc.printedText: {8}, {T} Aladdin's Ring does 4 damage to any target.
mc.flavorText: "After these words the magician drew a ring off his finger, and put it on one of Aladdin's, saying: --'It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'"The Arabian Nights, Junior Classics trans.

mc.name: Ankh of Mishra
mc.oracleText: Whenever a land comes into play, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
mc.printedText: Ankh does 2 damage to anyone who puts a new land into play.

mc.name: Armageddon Clock
mc.oracleText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a doom counter on Armageddon Clock.
At the beginning of your draw step, Armageddon Clock deals damage to each player equal to the number of doom counters on it.
{4}: Remove a doom counter from Armageddon Clock. Any player may play this ability but only during any upkeep step.
mc.printedText: Put one counter on Armageddon Clock during each of your upkeeps. At the end of your upkeep, each player takes damage equal to the number of counters on the Clock. Any player may spend {4} during any upkeep to remove a counter.

mc.name: Basalt Monolith
mc.oracleText:
Basalt Monolith doesn't untap during your untap step.
{3}: Untap Basalt Monolith.
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: {T}: Add 3 colorless mana to your mana pool. Does not untap as normal during untap phase; you may spend {3} at any other time to untap. Drawing mana from this artifact is played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Black Vise
mc.oracleText:
As Black Vise comes into play, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Black Vise deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand minus 4.
mc.printedText: If opponent has more than four cards in hand during his or her upkeep, Black Vise does 1 damage to opponent for each card in excess of four.

mc.name: Bottle of Suleiman
mc.oracleText: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you. If you win the flip, put a 5/5 Djinn artifact creature token with flying into play.
mc.printedText: {1}: Flip a coin, with opponent calling heads or tails while coin is in the air. If the flip ends up in opponent's favor, Bottle of Suleiman does 5 damage to you. Otherwise, a 5/5 flying Djinn immediately comes into play on your side. Use a counter to represent Djinn. Djinn is treated exactly like a normal artifact creature except that if it leaves play it is removed from the game entirely. No matter how the flip turns out, Bottle of Suleiman is discarded after use.

mc.name: Brass Man
mc.oracleText:
Brass Man doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap Brass Man.
mc.printedText: Brass Man does not untap as normal; you must pay {1} during your upkeep phase to untap it.

mc.name: Celestial Prism
mc.oracleText: {2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: {2}, {T}: Provides 1 mana of any color. This use is played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Clockwork Beast
mc.oracleText:
Clockwork Beast comes into play with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this turn, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Play this ability only during your upkeep.
mc.printedText: Put seven +1/+0 counters on Beast. After Beast attacks or blocks a creature, discard a counter. During the upkeep phase, controller may buy back lost counters for {1} per counter; this taps Beast.

mc.name: Conservator
mc.oracleText: {3}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
mc.printedText: {3}, {T}: Prevent the loss of up to 2 life.

mc.name: Crystal Rod
mc.oracleText: Whenever a player plays a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: {1}: Any blue spell cast gives you 1 life. Can only give 1 life each time a blue spell is cast.

mc.name: Dancing Scimitar
mc.oracleText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
mc.printedText: Flying
mc.flavorText: Bobbing merrily from opponent to opponent, the scimitar began adding playful little flourishes to its strokes; it even turned a couple of somersaults.

mc.name: Dingus Egg
mc.oracleText: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from play, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
mc.printedText: Whenever anyone loses a land, Dingus Egg does 2 damage to that player for each land lost.

mc.name: Disrupting Scepter
mc.oracleText: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Play this ability only during your turn.
mc.printedText: {3}, {T}: Opponent must discard one card of his or her choice. Can only be used during controller's turn.

mc.name: Dragon Engine
mc.oracleText: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
mc.flavorText: Those who believed the city of Kroog would never fall to Mishra's forces severely underestimated the might of his war machines.

mc.name: Ebony Horse
mc.oracleText: {2}, {T}: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.
mc.printedText: {2}, {T}: Remove one of your attacking creatures from combat. Treat this as if the creature never attacked, except that defenders assigned to block it cannot choose to block another creature.

mc.name: Flying Carpet
mc.oracleText: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
mc.printedText: {2}, {T}: Gives one creature flying ability until end of turn. If that creature is destroyed before end of turn, so is Flying Carpet.

mc.name: Glasses of Urza
mc.oracleText: {T}: Look at target player's hand.
mc.printedText: {T}: You may look at opponent's hand.

mc.name: Helm of Chatzuk
mc.oracleText: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains banding until end of turn.
mc.printedText: {1}, {T}: You may give one creature banding ability until end of turn.

mc.name: Howling Mine
mc.oracleText: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws a card.
mc.printedText: Each player must draw one extra card during the draw phase of each of his or her turns.

mc.name: Iron Star
mc.oracleText: Whenever a player plays a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: {1}: Any red spell cast gives you 1 life. Can only give 1 life each time a red spell is cast.

mc.name: Ivory Cup
mc.oracleText: Whenever a player plays a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: {1}: Any white spell cast gives you 1 life. Can only give 1 life each time a white spell is cast.

mc.name: Ivory Tower
mc.oracleText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain X life, where X is the number of cards in your hand minus four.
mc.printedText: During your upkeep phase, gain 1 life for each card in your hand above four.
mc.flavorText: Valuing scholarship above all else, the inhabitants of the Ivory Tower reward those who sacrifice power for knowledge.

mc.name: Jade Monolith
mc.oracleText: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.
mc.printedText: {1}: You may take damage done to any creature on yourself instead, but you must take all of it. Source of damage is unchanged.

mc.name: Jandor's Ring
mc.oracleText: {2}, {T}, Discard the last card you drew this turn: Draw a card.
mc.printedText: {2}, {T}: Discard a card you just drew from your library, and draw another card to replace it.

mc.name: Jandor's Saddlebags
mc.oracleText: {3}, {T}: Untap target creature.
mc.printedText: {3}, {T}: Untap a creature.
mc.flavorText: Each day of their journey, Jandor opened the saddlebags and found them full of mutton, quinces, cheese, date rolls, wine, and all manner of delicious and satisfying foods.

mc.name: Jayemdae Tome
mc.oracleText: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
mc.printedText: {4}, {T}: Draw one extra card.

mc.name: Juggernaut
mc.oracleText:
Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.
mc.printedText: Must attack each turn if possible. Can't be blocked by walls.
mc.flavorText: We had taken refuge in a small cave, thinking the entrance was too narrow for it to follow. To our horror, its gigantic head smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new entrance.

mc.name: Kormus Bell
mc.oracleText: All Swamps are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.
mc.printedText: Treat all swamps in play as 1/1 creatures. Now they can be enchanted, killed, and so forth, and they can be tapped either for mana or to attack.

mc.name: Library of Leng
mc.oracleText:
You have no maximum hand size.
If an effect causes you to discard a card, discard it, but you may put it on top of your library instead of into your graveyard.
mc.printedText: You must skip the discard phase of your turn. If a card forces you to discard, you may choose to discard to top of your library rather than to graveyard. If discard is random, you may look at card before deciding where to discard it.

mc.name: Living Wall
mc.oracleText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}: Regenerate Living Wall.
mc.printedText: Counts as a wall. {1}: Regenerates.
mc.flavorText: Some fiendish mage had created a horrifying wall of living flesh, patched together from a jumble of still-recognizable body parts. As we sought to hew our way through it, some unknown power healed the gaping wounds we cut, denying us passage.

mc.name: Mana Vault
mc.oracleText:
Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.

At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.

{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: {T}: Add 3 colorless mana to your mana pool. Mana Vault doesn't untap normally during untap phase; to untap it, you must pay 4 mana during your upkeep. If Mana Vault remains tapped during upkeep it does 1 damage to you. Drawing mana from this artifact is played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Meekstone
mc.oracleText: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
mc.printedText: Any creature with power greater than 2 may not be untapped as normal during the untap phase.

mc.name: Millstone
mc.oracleText: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
mc.printedText: {2}, {T}: Take the top two cards from target player's library and put them in target player's graveyard.
mc.flavorText: More than one mage was driven insane by the sound of the Millstone relentlessly grinding away.

mc.name: Mishra's War Machine
mc.oracleText:
Banding
At the beginning of your upkeep, unless you discard a card, tap Mishra's War Machine and it deals 3 damage to you.
mc.printedText:
Bands
During your upkeep, discard one card of your choice from your hand, or Mishra's War Machine becomes tapped and does 3 points of damage to you.

mc.name: Nevinyrral's Disk
mc.oracleText:
Nevinyrral's Disk comes into play tapped.
{1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.
mc.printedText: {1}: Destroys all creatures, enchantments, and artifacts in play, including Disk itself. Disk begins tapped but can be untapped as usual.

mc.name: Obsianus Golem
mc.flavorText:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone. . ."
--Song of the Artificer

mc.name: Onulet
mc.oracleText: When Onulet is put into a graveyard from play, you gain 2 life.
mc.printedText: If Onulet is placed in the graveyard, its controller gains 2 life.
mc.flavorText: An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's Onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.

mc.name: Ornithopter
mc.oracleText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
mc.printedText: Flying
mc.flavorText: Many scholars believe that these creatures were the result of Urza's first attempt at mechanical life, perhaps created in his early days as an apprentice to Tocasia.

mc.name: Primal Clay
mc.oracleText: Primal Clay comes into play as your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Shapeshifter Wall artifact creature with defender.
mc.printedText: When you cast Primal Clay, you must choose whether to make it a 1/6 wall, a 3/3 creature, or a 2/2 flying creature. Primal Clay then remains in this form until altered by another card or removed from play.

mc.name: Rocket Launcher
mc.oracleText: {2}: Rocket Launcher deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Sacrifice Rocket Launcher at end of turn. Play this ability only if you've controlled Rocket Launcher continuously since the most recent beginning of your turn.
mc.printedText: {2}: Do 1 damage to any target. Rocket Launcher may not be used until it begins a turn in play on your side. If it is used, Rocket Launcher is destroyed at end of turn.
mc.flavorText: What these devices lacked in subtlety, they made up in strength.

mc.name: Rod of Ruin
mc.oracleText: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
mc.printedText: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin does 1 damage to any target.

mc.name: Sol Ring
mc.oracleText: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: {T}: Add 2 colorless mana to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Soul Net
mc.oracleText: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: {1}: You gain 1 life every time a creature is placed in the graveyard. Can only give 1 life each time a creature is placed in the graveyard.

mc.name: Sunglasses of Urza
mc.oracleText: You may spend white mana as though it were red mana.
mc.printedText: White mana in your mana pool can be used as either white or red mana.

mc.name: The Hive
mc.oracleText: {5}, {T}: Put a 1/1 Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp into play. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
mc.printedText: {5}, {T}: Creates one Giant Wasp, a 1/1 flying creature. Represent Wasps with tokens, making sure to indicate when each Wasp is tapped. Wasps can't attack during the turn created. Treat Wasps like artifact creatures in every way, except that they are removed from the game entirely if they ever leave play. If the Hive is destroyed, the Wasps must still be killed individually.

mc.name: The Rack
mc.oracleText:
As The Rack comes into play, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, The Rack deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in his or her hand.
mc.printedText: If opponent has fewer than three cards in hand during his or her upkeep, the Rack does 1 damage to opponent for each card fewer than three.
mc.flavorText: Invented in Mishra's earlier days, the Rack was once his most feared creation.

mc.name: Throne of Bone
mc.oracleText: Whenever a player plays a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: {1}: Any black spell cast gives you 1 life. Can only give 1 life each time a black spell is cast.

mc.name: Winter Orb
mc.oracleText: As long as Winter Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.
mc.printedText: A player may not untap more than one land during the untap phase of each of his or her turns.

mc.name: Wooden Sphere
mc.oracleText: Whenever a player plays a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: {1}: Any green spell cast gives you 1 life. Can only give 1 life each time a green spell is cast.

mc.name: Animate Dead
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Animate Dead comes into play, if it's in play, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put into play with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to play under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves play, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.
mc.printedText: Any creature in any graveyard comes into play on your side with -1 to its original power. At end of game, or if this enchantment is discarded without removing target creature from play, target creature is returned to its owner's graveyard. Target creature may be killed as normal.

mc.name: Bad Moon
mc.oracleText: Black creatures get +1/+1.
mc.printedText: All black creatures in play gain +1/+1.

mc.name: Black Knight
mc.oracleText:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
mc.printedText: Protection from white, first strike
mc.flavorText: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.

mc.name: Bog Wraith
mc.oracleText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
mc.printedText: Swampwalk
mc.flavorText:
'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

mc.name: Contract from Below
mc.oracleText:
Remove Contract from Below from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
Discard your hand, add the top card of your library to the ante, then draw seven cards.
mc.printedText: Discard your current hand and draw eight new cards, adding the first drawn to your ante. Remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.

mc.name: Cursed Land
mc.oracleText:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.
mc.printedText: Cursed Land does 1 damage to target land's controller during his or her upkeep.

mc.name: Dark Ritual
mc.oracleText: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

mc.name: Darkpact
mc.oracleText:
Remove Darkpact from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
You own target card in the ante. Exchange that card with the top of your library.
mc.printedText: Swap top card of your library with either card of the ante; this swap is permanent. You must have a card in your library to cast this spell. Remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.

mc.name: Deathgrip
mc.oracleText: {B}{B}: Counter target green spell.
mc.printedText: {B}{B}: Counter a green spell as it is being cast. This ability is played as an interrupt and does not affect green cards already in play.

mc.name: Deathlace
mc.oracleText: Target spell or permanent becomes black. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
mc.printedText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to black. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

mc.name: Demonic Attorney
mc.oracleText:
Remove Demonic Attorney from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.

Each player antes the top card of his or her library.
mc.printedText: If opponent doesn't concede the game immediately, each player must ante an additional card from the top of his or her library. Remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.

mc.name: Demonic Hordes
mc.oracleText:
{T}: Destroy target land.

At the beginning of your upkeep, unless you pay {B}{B}{B}, tap Demonic Hordes and sacrifice a land of an opponent's choice.
mc.printedText:
{T}: Destroy 1 land.
Pay {B}{B}{B} during your upkeep or the Hordes become tapped and you lose a land of opponent's choice.
mc.flavorText: Created to destroy Dominia, Demons can sometimes be bent to a more focused purpose.

mc.name: Demonic Tutor
mc.oracleText: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
mc.printedText: Search your library for one card and take it into your hand. Reshuffle your library afterwards.

mc.name: Drain Life
mc.oracleText:
Spend only black mana on X.

Drain Life deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before Drain Life dealt damage or the creature's toughness.
mc.printedText: Drain Life does 1 damage to a single target for each {B} spent in addition to the casting cost. Caster gains 1 life for each damage inflicted. If you drain life from a creature, you cannot gain more life than the creature's current toughness.

mc.name: Drudge Skeletons
mc.oracleText: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
mc.printedText: {B}: Regenerates.
mc.flavorText: Bones scattered around us joined to form misshapen bodies. We struck at them repeatedly--they fell, but soon formed again, with the same mocking look on their faceless skulls.

mc.name: El-Hajj√¢j
mc.oracleText: Lifelink (Whenever this creature deals damage, you gain that much life.)
mc.printedText: You gain 1 life for every point of damage El-Hajjaj inflicts.

mc.name: Erg Raiders
mc.oracleText: At the end of your turn, if Erg Raiders didn't attack this turn, Erg Raiders deals 2 damage to you unless it came under your control this turn.
mc.printedText: If you do not attack with Raiders, they do 2 damage to you at end of turn. Raiders do no damage to you during the turn in which they are summoned.

mc.name: Evil Presence
mc.oracleText:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a Swamp.
mc.printedText: Target land is now a basic swamp.

mc.name: Fear
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
mc.printedText: Target creature cannot be blocked by any creatures except black creatures and artifact creatures.

mc.name: Frozen Shade
mc.oracleText: {B}: Frozen Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
mc.flavorText:
"There are some qualities--some incorporate things,/ That have a double life, which thus is made/ A type of twin entity which springs/ From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade."
--Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"

mc.name: Gloom
mc.oracleText: White spells and activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to play.
mc.printedText: White spells cost 3 more mana to cast. White enchantments with activation costs require 3 more mana to use.

mc.name: Howl from Beyond
mc.oracleText: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: Target creature gains +X/+0 until end of turn.

mc.name: Hypnotic Specter
mc.oracleText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.
mc.printedText:
Flying
An opponent damaged by Specter must discard a card at random from his or her hand. Ignore this effect if opponent has no cards left in hand.
mc.flavorText: ". . . There was no trace/ Of aught on that illumined face. . ."Samuel Coleridge, "Phantom"

mc.name: Lord of the Pit
mc.oracleText:
Flying, trample (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach. If this creature would deal enough combat damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.
mc.printedText:
Flying, trample
You must sacrifice one of your own creatures during your upkeep or Lord of the Pit does 7 damage to you. You may still attack with Lord of the Pit even if you failed to sacrifice a creature. Lord of the Pit may not be sacrificed to itself.

mc.name: Mind Twist
mc.oracleText: Target player discards X cards at random.
mc.printedText: Opponent must discard X cards at random from hand. If opponent doesn't have enough cards in hand, entire hand is discarded.

mc.name: Nether Shadow
mc.oracleText:
Haste
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Shadow is in your graveyard with three or more creature cards above it, you may put Nether Shadow into play.
mc.printedText: If Shadow is in graveyard with any combination of cards above it that includes at least three creatures, it can be returned to play during your upkeep. Shadow can attack on same turn summoned or returned to play.

mc.name: Nettling Imp
mc.oracleText: {T}: Choose target non-Wall creature the active player has controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn. That creature attacks this turn if able. If it doesn't, destroy it at end of turn. Play this ability only during an opponent's turn, before attackers are declared.
mc.printedText: {T}: Force a particular one of opponent's non-wall creatures to attack. If target creature cannot attack, it is killed at end of turn. This ability can only be used during opponent's turn, before the attack. May not be used on creatures summoned this turn.

mc.name: Nightmare
mc.oracleText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
mc.printedText:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness both equal the number of swamps its controller has in play.
mc.flavorText: The nightmare arises from its lair in the swamps. As the poisoned land spreads, so does the Nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

mc.name: Paralyze
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
When Paralyze comes into play, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {4}. If he or she does, untap the creature.
mc.printedText: Target creature is not untapped as normal during untap phase. Creature's controller may spend {4} during his or her upkeep to untap it. Tap target creature when Paralyze is cast.

mc.name: Pestilence
mc.oracleText:
At end of turn, if no creatures are in play, sacrifice Pestilence.

{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
mc.printedText:
{B}: Do 1 damage to each creature and to both players.
If there are no creatures in play at the end of any turn, Pestilence must be discarded.

mc.name: Plague Rats
mc.oracleText: Plague Rats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures named Plague Rats in play.
mc.printedText: The *s below are the number of Plague Rats in play, counting both sides. Thus if there are two Plague Rats in play, each has power and toughness 2/2.
mc.flavorText:
"Should you a Rat to madness tease
Why ev'n a Rat may plague you. . ."
--Samuel Coleridge, "Recantation"

mc.name: Raise Dead
mc.oracleText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
mc.printedText: Bring one creature from your graveyard to your hand.

mc.name: Royal Assassin
mc.oracleText: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
mc.printedText: {T}: Destroy any tapped creature.
mc.flavorText: Trained in the arts of stealth, the royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

mc.name: Sacrifice
mc.oracleText:
As an additional cost to play Sacrifice, sacrifice a creature.

Add to your mana pool an amount of black mana equal to the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost.
mc.printedText: Sacrifice one of your creatures to add to your mana pool a number of black mana equal to that creature's casting cost.

mc.name: Scathe Zombies
mc.flavorText:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,/ Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;/ It had been strange, even in a dream,/ To have seen those dead men rise."/
--Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

mc.name: Scavenging Ghoul
mc.oracleText:
At end of turn, put a corpse counter on Scavenging Ghoul for each creature put into a graveyard from play that turn.
Remove a corpse counter from Scavenging Ghoul: Regenerate Scavenging Ghoul.
mc.printedText: At the end of each turn, put one counter on Ghoul for each other creature that was placed in the graveyard during the turn. If Ghoul takes lethal damage, you may use a counter to regenerate it; counters remain until used.

mc.name: Sengir Vampire
mc.oracleText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn is put into a graveyard, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
mc.printedText:
Flying
Vampire gets a +1/+1 counter each time a creature dies during a turn in which Vampire damaged it.

mc.name: Simulacrum
mc.oracleText: You gain life equal to the damage dealt to you this turn. Simulacrum deals damage to target creature you control equal to the damage dealt to you this turn.
mc.printedText: All damage done to you so far this turn is instead retroactively applied to one of your creatures in play. Even if there's more than enough damage to kill the creature, you don't suffer any of it. Further damage this turn is treated normally.

mc.name: Sorceress Queen
mc.oracleText: {T}: Target creature other than Sorceress Queen becomes 0/2 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: {T}: Make another creature 0/2 until end of turn. Treat this exactly as if the numbers in the lower right of the target card were 0/2. All special characteristics and enchantments on the creature are unaffected.

mc.name: Terror
mc.oracleText: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
mc.printedText: Buries target creature. Cannot target black creatures or artifact creatures.

mc.name: Unholy Strength
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
mc.printedText: Target creature gains +2/+1.

mc.name: Wall of Bone
mc.oracleText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone.
mc.printedText: {B}: Regenerates.
mc.flavorText: The Wall of Bone is said to be an aspect of the Great Wall in Hel, where the bones of all sinners wait for Ragnarok, when Hela will call them forth for the final battle.

mc.name: Warp Artifact
mc.oracleText:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.
mc.printedText: Warp Artifact does 1 damage to target artifact's controller during his or her upkeep.

mc.name: Weakness
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.
mc.printedText: Target creature loses -2/-1.

mc.name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
mc.oracleText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
{B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
mc.printedText: Flying; {B}: Regenerates.
mc.flavorText:
"About, about in reel and rout
The death-fires danced at night;
The water, like a witch's oils,
Burnt green, and blue and white."
--Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

mc.name: Zombie Master
mc.oracleText:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk.
All other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."
mc.printedText: All zombies in play gain swampwalk and "{B}: Regenerates" for as long as this card remains in play.
mc.flavorText: They say the Zombie Master controlled these foul creatures even before his own death, but now that he is one of them, nothing can make them betray him.

mc.name: Air Elemental
mc.oracleText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
mc.printedText: Flying
mc.flavorText: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild, and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.

mc.name: Animate Artifact
mc.oracleText:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact is a creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. It's still an artifact.
mc.printedText: Target artifact is now an artifact creature with both power and toughness equal to its casting cost; target retains all its original abilities as well. Has no effect on artifact creatures.

mc.name: Blue Elemental Blast
mc.oracleText: Choose one - Counter target red spell; or destroy target red permanent.
mc.printedText: Counters a red spell being cast or destroys a red card in play.

mc.name: Braingeyser
mc.oracleText: Target player draws X cards.
mc.printedText: Target player must draw X cards.

mc.name: Clone
mc.oracleText: As Clone comes into play, you may choose a creature in play. If you do, Clone comes into play as a copy of that creature.
mc.printedText: Upon summoning, Clone acquires all characteristics, including color, of any one creature in play on either side; any creature enchantments on original creature are not copied. Clone retains these characteristics even after original creature is destroyed. Clone cannot be summoned if there are no creatures in play.

mc.name: Control Magic
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
mc.printedText: You control target creature until enchantment is discarded or game ends. If target creature is already tapped it stays tapped until you can untap it. If destroyed, target creature is put in its owner's graveyard.

mc.name: Copy Artifact
mc.oracleText: As Copy Artifact comes into play, you may choose an artifact in play. If you do, Copy Artifact comes into play as a copy of that artifact. It's still an enchantment.
mc.printedText: Select any artifact in play. This enchantment acts as a duplicate of that artifact; it is affected by cards that affect either enchantments or artifacts. The copy remains even if the original artifact is destroyed. Enchantments on the original artifact are not copied.

mc.name: Counterspell
mc.oracleText: Counter target spell.
mc.printedText: Counters target spell as it is being cast.

mc.name: Creature Bond
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard, Creature Bond deals damage equal to that creature's toughness to the creature's controller.
mc.printedText: If target creature is placed in the graveyard, Creature Bond does an amount of damage equal to creature's toughness to creature's controller.

mc.name: Drain Power
mc.oracleText: Target player plays a mana ability of each land he or she controls, then empties his or her mana pool. Add mana to your mana pool equal to the type and amount emptied from that player's mana pool this way.
mc.printedText: Opponent must draw all mana from his or her available lands; this mana and all mana in opponent's mana pool drains into your mana pool. You can't take less than all your opponent's mana.

mc.name: Energy Flux
mc.oracleText: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."
mc.printedText: All artifacts in play now require an upkeep cost of {2} in addition to any other upkeep costs they may have. If the upkeep cost for an artifact is not paid, the artifact must be discarded.

mc.name: Feedback
mc.oracleText:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, Feedback deals 1 damage to that player.
mc.printedText: Feedback does 1 damage to controller of target enchantment during its controller's upkeep.

mc.name: Flight
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
mc.printedText: Target creature is now a flying creature.

mc.name: Hurkyl's Recall
mc.oracleText: Return all artifacts target player owns to his or her hand.
mc.printedText: All artifacts in play owned by target player are returned to target player's hand. Any enchantments on those artifacts are discarded.
mc.flavorText: This spell, like many attributed to Drafna, was actually the work of his wife Hurkyl.

mc.name: Island Fish Jasconius
mc.oracleText:
Island Fish Jasconius can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
Jasconius doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {U}{U}{U}. If you do, untap Jasconius.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Jasconius.
mc.printedText: You must pay {U}{U}{U} during your upkeep phase to untap Island Fish. Island Fish cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play. Island Fish is destroyed immediately if at any time you have no islands in play.

mc.name: Jump
mc.oracleText: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
mc.printedText: Target creature is a flying creature until end of turn.

mc.name: Lifetap
mc.oracleText: Whenever a Forest an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: You gain 1 life each time any forest of opponent's becomes tapped.

mc.name: Lord of Atlantis
mc.oracleText: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk.
mc.printedText: All Merfolk in play gain islandwalk and +1/+1 while this card is in play.
mc.flavorText: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

mc.name: Magical Hack
mc.oracleText: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk.") (This effect doesn't end at end of turn.)
mc.printedText: Change the text of any card being played or already in play by replacing one basic land type with another. For example, you can change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk."

mc.name: Mahamoti Djinn
mc.oracleText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
mc.printedText: Flying
mc.flavorText: Of royal blood amongst the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

mc.name: Mana Short
mc.oracleText: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.
mc.printedText: All opponent's lands are tapped, and opponent's mana pool is emptied. Opponent takes no damage from unspent mana.

mc.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
mc.flavorText: Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

mc.name: Phantasmal Forces
mc.oracleText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.
mc.printedText:
Flying
Controller must spend {U} during upkeep to maintain or Phantasmal Forces are destroyed.
mc.flavorText: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.

mc.name: Phantasmal Terrain
mc.oracleText:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain comes into play, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.
mc.printedText: Target land changes to any basic land type of caster's choice. Land type is set when cast and may not be further altered by this card.

mc.name: Phantom Monster
mc.oracleText: Flying
mc.printedText: Flying
mc.flavorText:
"While, like a ghastly rapid river,
Through the pale door,
A hideous throng rush out forever,
And laugh--but smile no more."
--Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"

mc.name: Pirate Ship
mc.oracleText:
Pirate Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{T}: Pirate Ship deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Pirate Ship.
mc.printedText:
{T}: Do 1 damage to any target.
Cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play, though controller may still use special ability. Pirate Ship is destroyed immediately if at any time controller has no islands in play.

mc.name: Power Leak
mc.oracleText:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, that player may pay up to {2}. For each one mana less than {2} he or she pays this way, Power Leak deals 1 damage to him or her.
mc.printedText: Target enchantment costs 2 extra mana during the upkeep phase of each of its controller's turns. If target enchantment's controller cannot or will not pay this extra mana, Power Leak does 1 damage to him or her for each unpaid mana.

mc.name: Power Sink
mc.oracleText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.
mc.printedText: Target spell is countered unless its caster spends X more mana. Caster of target spell must draw and spend all available mana from lands and mana pool until X is spent; he or she may also spend mana from other sources if desired. If this is not enough mana, target spell will still be countered.

mc.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
mc.oracleText: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
mc.printedText: {T}: Do 1 damage to any target.
mc.flavorText: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

mc.name: Psychic Venom
mc.oracleText:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
mc.printedText: Whenever target land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom does 2 damage to target land's controller.

mc.name: Reconstruction
mc.oracleText: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
mc.printedText: Bring one artifact from your graveyard to your hand.
mc.flavorText: Tedious research made the Sages of the College of Lat-Nam adept in repairing broken artifacts.

mc.name: Sea Serpent
mc.oracleText:
Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

When you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.
mc.printedText: Serpent cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play. Serpent is buried immediately if at any time controller has no islands in play.
mc.flavorText: Legend has it that Serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?

mc.name: Serendib Efreet
mc.oracleText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, Serendib Efreet deals 1 damage to you.
mc.printedText:
Flying
Serendib Efreet does 1 damage to you during your upkeep.

mc.name: Siren's Call
mc.oracleText:
Play Siren's Call only during an opponent's turn and only before attackers are declared.
Creatures the active player controls attack this turn if able.
At end of turn, destroy all non-Wall creatures that player controls that didn't attack this turn. Ignore this effect for each creature the player didn't control continuously since the beginning of the turn.
mc.printedText: All of opponent's creatures that can attack must do so. Any non-wall creatures that cannot attack are killed at end of turn. Can be played only during opponent's turn, before opponent's attack. Creatures summoned this turn are unaffected by Siren's Call.

mc.name: Sleight of Mind
mc.oracleText: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (For example, you may change "target black spell" to "target blue spell.") (This effect doesn't end at end of turn.)
mc.printedText: Change the text of any card being played or already in play by replacing one color word with another. For example, you can change "Counters red spells" to "Counters black spells." Sleight of Mind cannot change mana symbols.

mc.name: Spell Blast
mc.oracleText: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X.
mc.printedText: Target spell is countered; X is casting cost of target spell.

mc.name: Stasis
mc.oracleText:
Players skip their untap steps.

At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.
mc.printedText: Players do not get an untap phase. Pay {U} during your upkeep or Stasis is destroyed; cards still do not untap until the next untap phase.

mc.name: Steal Artifact
mc.oracleText:
Enchant artifact
You control enchanted artifact.
mc.printedText: You control target artifact until enchantment is discarded or game ends. If target artifact was tapped when stolen, it stays tapped until you can untap it. If destroyed, target artifact is put in its owner's graveyard.

mc.name: Thoughtlace
mc.oracleText: Target spell or permanent becomes blue. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
mc.printedText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to blue. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

mc.name: Unstable Mutation
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.
mc.printedText: Target creature gains +3/+3. During the upkeep phase of each of its controller's turns, put a -1/-1 counter on the creature. These counters remain even if this enchantment is removed before the creature dies.

mc.name: Unsummon
mc.oracleText: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
mc.printedText: Return target creature to owner's hand; enchantments on target creature are discarded.

mc.name: Vesuvan Doppelganger
mc.oracleText: As Vesuvan Doppelganger comes into play, you may choose a creature in play. If you do, Vesuvan Doppelganger comes into play as a copy of that creature except for its color and gains "At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have this creature become a copy of target creature except for its color. If you do, this creature gains this ability."
mc.printedText: Upon summoning, Doppelganger acquires all characteristics except color of any one creature in play on either side; any creature enchantments on the original creature are not copied. During controller's upkeep, Doppelganger may take on the characteristics of a different creature in play instead. Doppelganger may continue to copy a creature even after that creature leaves play, but if it switches it won't be able to switch back.

mc.name: Volcanic Eruption
mc.oracleText: Destroy X target Mountains. Volcanic Eruption deals damage to each creature and each player equal to the number of Mountains destroyed this way.
mc.printedText: Destroys X mountains of your choice, and does 1 damage to each player and each creature in play for each mountain destroyed.

mc.name: Wall of Air
mc.oracleText: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
mc.printedText: Flying
mc.flavorText: "This --'standing windstorm' can hold us off indefinitely? Ridiculous" Saying nothing, she put a pinch of salt on the table. With a bang she clapped her hands, and the salt disappeared, blown away.

mc.name: Wall of Water
mc.oracleText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}: Wall of Water gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
mc.flavorText: A deafening roar arose as the fury of an enormous vertical river supplanted our serenity. Eddies turned into whirling geysers, leveling everything in their path.

mc.name: Water Elemental
mc.flavorText: Unpredictable as the sea itself, Water Elementals shift without warning from tranquility to tempest. Capricious and fickle, they flow restlessly from one shape to another, expressing their moods with their physical forms.

mc.name: Aspect of Wolf
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+Y, where X is equal to half the number of Forests you control, rounded down, and Y is equal to half the number of Forests you control, rounded up.
mc.printedText: Target creature's power and toughness are increased by half the number of forests you have in play, rounding down for power and up for toughness.

mc.name: Birds of Paradise
mc.oracleText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
mc.printedText:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Channel
mc.oracleText: Until end of turn, any time you could play a mana ability you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {1} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: Until end of turn, you may add colorless mana to your mana pool at a cost of 1 life per point of mana. These additions are played with the speed of an interrupt. Effects that prevent or redirect damage may not be used to counter this loss of life.

mc.name: Cockatrice
mc.oracleText:
Flying
Whenever Cockatrice blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
mc.printedText:
Flying
Any non-wall creature blocking Cockatrice is destroyed, as is any creature blocked by Cockatrice. Creatures destroyed in this way deal their damage before dying.

mc.name: Craw Wurm
mc.flavorText: The most terrifying thing about the Craw Wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

mc.name: Crumble
mc.oracleText: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.
mc.printedText: Buries target artifact. Artifact's controller gains life points equal to target artifact's casting cost.
mc.flavorText: The spirits of Argoth grant new life to those who repent the folly of enslaving their labors to devices.

mc.name: Desert Twister
mc.oracleText: Destroy target permanent.
mc.printedText: Destroy any card in play.

mc.name: Elvish Archers
mc.oracleText: First strike
mc.printedText: First strike
mc.flavorText: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade"

mc.name: Fastbond
mc.oracleText:
You may play as many lands as you choose on your turn.

Whenever you play a land other than the first land of the turn, Fastbond deals 1 damage to you.
mc.printedText: You may put as many lands into play as you want each turn. Fastbond does 1 damage to you for every land beyond the first that you play in a single turn.

mc.name: Fog
mc.oracleText: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
mc.printedText: Creatures attack and block as normal, but none deal any damage or otherwise affect any creature as a result of an attack or block. All attacking creatures are still tapped. Play any time before attack damage is dealt.

mc.name: Force of Nature
mc.oracleText:
Trample (If this creature would deal enough combat damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.
mc.printedText:
Trample
You must pay {G}{G}{G}{G} during your upkeep or Force of Nature does 8 damage to you. You may still attack with Force of Nature even if you failed to pay the upkeep.

mc.name: Fungusaur
mc.oracleText: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
mc.printedText: At the end of any turn during which Fungusaur was damaged but not destroyed, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
mc.flavorText: Rather than sheltering her young, the female fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.

mc.name: Gaea's Liege
mc.oracleText:
As long as Gaea's Liege isn't attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control. As long as Gaea's Liege is attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests defending player controls.
{T}: Target land becomes a Forest until Gaea's Liege leaves play.
mc.printedText: {T}: Turn any one land into a basic forest. Mark changed lands with counters, removing the counters when Gaea's Liege leaves play. Gaea's Liege has power and toughness equal to the number of forests controller has in play; when it's attacking, they are equal to the number of forests defending player has in play.

mc.name: Giant Growth
mc.oracleText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: Target creature gains +3/+3 until end of turn.

mc.name: Giant Spider
mc.oracleText: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
mc.printedText: Does not fly, but can block flying creatures.
mc.flavorText: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

mc.name: Grizzly Bears
mc.flavorText: Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

mc.name: Hurricane
mc.oracleText: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
mc.printedText: All players and flying creatures suffer X damage.

mc.name: Instill Energy
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Play this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.
mc.printedText: You may untap target creature one additional time during your turn. Target creature may also attack the turn it comes into play.

mc.name: Ironroot Treefolk
mc.flavorText: The mating habits of Treefolk, particularly the stalwart Ironroot Treefolk, are truly absurd. Molasses comes to mind. It's amazing the species can survive at all given such protracted periods of mate selection, conjugation, and gestation.

mc.name: Kudzu
mc.oracleText:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it. That land's controller attaches Kudzu to a land of his or her choice.
mc.printedText: When target land becomes tapped, it is destroyed. Unless that was the last land in play, Kudzu is not discarded; instead, the player whose land it just destroyed may place it on any other land in play.

mc.name: Ley Druid
mc.oracleText: {T}: Untap target land.
mc.printedText: {T}: Untap a land of your choice. This ability is played as an interrupt.
mc.flavorText: After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

mc.name: Lifeforce
mc.oracleText: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.
mc.printedText: {G}{G}: Counter a black spell as it is being cast. This use is played as an interrupt and does not affect black cards already in play.

mc.name: Lifelace
mc.oracleText: Target spell or permanent becomes green. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
mc.printedText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to green. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

mc.name: Living Artifact
mc.oracleText:
Enchant artifact
Whenever you're dealt damage, put that many vitality counters on Living Artifact.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a vitality counter from Living Artifact. If you do, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: Put a counter on target artifact for each life you lose. During your upkeep you may trade one counter for one life, but you can only trade in one counter during each of your upkeeps.

mc.name: Living Lands
mc.oracleText: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.
mc.printedText: Treat all forests in play as 1/1 creatures. Now they can be enchanted, killed, and so forth, and they can be tapped either for mana or to attack.

mc.name: Llanowar Elves
mc.oracleText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.
mc.flavorText: Whenever the Llanowar Elves gather the fruits of their forest, they leave one plant of each type untouched, considering that nature's portion.

mc.name: Lure
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
mc.printedText: All creatures able to block target creature must do so. If a creature has the ability to block more than one creature, Lure does not prevent this. If there is more than one attacking creature with Lure, defender may choose which of them each defending creature blocks.

mc.name: Regeneration
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
mc.printedText: {G}: Target creature regenerates.

mc.name: Regrowth
mc.oracleText: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
mc.printedText: Bring any card from your graveyard to your hand.

mc.name: Scryb Sprites
mc.oracleText: Flying
mc.printedText: Flying
mc.flavorText: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the Faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

mc.name: Shanodin Dryads
mc.oracleText: Forestwalk
mc.printedText: Forestwalk
mc.flavorText: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the Dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.

mc.name: Stream of Life
mc.oracleText: Target player gains X life.
mc.printedText: Target player gains X life.

mc.name: Thicket Basilisk
mc.oracleText: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
mc.printedText: Any non-wall creature blocking Basilisk is destroyed, as is any creature blocked by Basilisk. Creatures destroyed this way deal their damage before dying.
mc.flavorText: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the Basilisk's power.

mc.name: Timber Wolves
mc.oracleText: Banding
mc.printedText: Bands
mc.flavorText: Though many think of Wolves as solitary predators, they are actually extremely social animals. During a hunt they often call to each other, which can be quite unsettling for their prey.

mc.name: Titania's Song
mc.oracleText: Each noncreature artifact loses its abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. If Titania's Song leaves play, this effect continues until end of turn.
mc.printedText: All non-creature artifacts in play lose all their usual abilities and become artifact creatures with toughness and power both equal to their casting costs. If Titania's Song leaves play, artifacts return to normal just before the untap phase of the next turn.

mc.name: Tranquility
mc.oracleText: Destroy all enchantments.
mc.printedText: All enchantments in play must be discarded.

mc.name: Tsunami
mc.oracleText: Destroy all Islands.
mc.printedText: All islands in play are destroyed.

mc.name: Verduran Enchantress
mc.oracleText: Whenever you play an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
mc.printedText: While Enchantress is in play, you may immediately draw a card from your library each time you cast an enchantment.
mc.flavorText: Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.

mc.name: Wall of Brambles
mc.oracleText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}: Regenerate Wall of Brambles.
mc.printedText: {G}: Regenerates.
mc.flavorText:
"What else, when chaos draws all forces inward to shape a single leaf."
--Conrad Aiken

mc.name: Wall of Ice
mc.oracleText: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
mc.flavorText:
"And through the drifts the snowy cliffs
Did send a dismal sheen:
Nor shapes of men nor beasts we ken--
The ice was all between."
--Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

mc.name: Wall of Wood
mc.oracleText: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
mc.flavorText: Everybody knows that to ward off trouble, you knock on wood. But usually it's better to make a wall out of the wood and let the trouble do the knocking.

mc.name: Wanderlust
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Wanderlust deals 1 damage to that player.
mc.printedText: Wanderlust does 1 damage to target creature's controller during his or her upkeep.

mc.name: War Mammoth
mc.oracleText: Trample
mc.printedText: Trample
mc.flavorText: I didn't think Mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.

mc.name: Web
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
mc.printedText: Target creature gains +0/+2 and can now block flying creatures, though it does not gain flying ability.

mc.name: Wild Growth
mc.oracleText:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool.
mc.printedText: Whenever the usual mana is drawn from target land, Wild Growth provides an extra {G}.

mc.name: Atog
mc.oracleText: Sacrifice an artifact: Atog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: {0}: +2/+2. Each time you use this ability, you must sacrifice one of your artifacts in play.
mc.flavorText: The bane of all artificers, the legendary Atogs devoured intricate tools to further their own twisted growth.

mc.name: Burrowing
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has mountainwalk.
mc.printedText: Target creature gains mountainwalk.

mc.name: Chaoslace
mc.oracleText: Target spell or permanent becomes red. (Its mana symbols remain unchanged.)
mc.printedText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to red. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

mc.name: Disintegrate
mc.oracleText: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. That creature can't be regenerated this turn. If the creature would be put into a graveyard this turn, remove it from the game instead.
mc.printedText: Disintegrate does X damage to one target. If target dies this turn, target is removed from the game entirely.

mc.name: Dragon Whelp
mc.oracleText:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. At end of turn, if this ability has been played four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp.
mc.printedText:
Flying
{R}: +1/+0; if more than {R}{R}{R} is spent in this way during one turn, Dragon Whelp is killed at end of turn.
mc.flavorText:
"O to be a dragon . . . of silkworm size or immense . . ."
--Marianne Moore, "O to Be a Dragon"

mc.name: Dwarven Warriors
mc.oracleText: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn.
mc.printedText: {T}: Make a creature of power no greater than 2 unblockable until end of turn. Other cards may later be used to increase target creature's power beyond 2.

mc.name: Dwarven Weaponsmith
mc.oracleText: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. Play this ability only during your upkeep.
mc.printedText: {T}: During your upkeep, add a permanent +1/+1 counter to any creature. Each time you use this ability, you must sacrifice one of your artifacts in play.
mc.flavorText:
"Work with zeal as hammers peal Melt, anneal, and pound the steel"
--Old Dwarvish forge-chant

mc.name: Earth Elemental
mc.flavorText: Earth Elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.

mc.name: Earthbind
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
When Earthbind comes into play, if enchanted creature has flying, Earthbind deals 2 damage to that creature and Earthbind gains "Enchanted creature loses flying."
mc.printedText: If cast on a flying creature, Earthbind removes flying ability and does 2 damage to target creature; this damage occurs only once, at the time Earthbind is cast. If another spell or effect later gives target creature flying ability, Earthbind does not affect this. Earthbind has no effect on non-flying creatures.

mc.name: Earthquake
mc.oracleText: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
mc.printedText: Does X damage to each player and each non-flying creature in play.

mc.name: Fire Elemental
mc.flavorText: Fire Elementals are ruthless infernos, annihilating and consuming their foes in a frenzied holocaust. Crackling and blazing, they sear swift, terrible paths, leaving the land charred and scorched in their wake.

mc.name: Fireball
mc.oracleText:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
As an additional cost to play Fireball, pay {1} for each target beyond the first.
mc.printedText: Fireball does X damage total, divided evenly (round down) among any number of targets. Pay 1 extra mana for each target beyond the first.

mc.name: Firebreathing
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
mc.flavorText:
"And topples round the dreary west
A looming bastion fringed with fire."
--Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "In Memoriam"

mc.name: Flashfires
mc.oracleText: Destroy all Plains.
mc.printedText: All plains in play are destroyed.

mc.name: Fork
mc.oracleText: Copy target instant or sorcery spell, except that it copies Fork's color. You may choose new targets for the copy.
mc.printedText: Any one sorcery or instant spell just cast is duplicated. Treat Fork as an exact copy of target spell except that Fork remains red. Caster of Fork chooses the copy's target.

mc.name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
mc.oracleText: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.
mc.printedText: {R}: Gains flying ability until end of turn.
mc.flavorText: "From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks" "Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"

mc.name: Goblin King
mc.oracleText: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
mc.printedText: All Goblins in play gain mountainwalk and +1/+1 while this card remains in play.
mc.flavorText: To become king of the Goblins, one must assassinate the previous king. Thus, only the most foolish seek positions of leadership.

mc.name: Granite Gargoyle
mc.oracleText:
Flying
{R}: Granite Gargoyle gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: Flying; {R}: +0/+1
mc.flavorText:
"While most overworlders fortunately don't realize this, Gargoyles can be most delicious, providing you have the appropriate tools to carve them."
--The Underworld Cookbook, by Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar.

mc.name: Gray Ogre
mc.flavorText: The Ogre philosopher Gnerdel believed the purpose of life was to live as high on the food chain as possible. She refused to eat vegetarians, and preferred to live entirely on creatures that preyed on sentient beings.

mc.name: Hill Giant
mc.flavorText: Fortunately, Hill Giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

mc.name: Hurloon Minotaur
mc.flavorText: The Minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.

mc.name: Keldon Warlord
mc.oracleText: Keldon Warlord's power and toughness are each equal to the number of non-Wall creatures you control.
mc.printedText: The *s below are the number of non-wall creatures on your side, including Warlord. Thus if you have two other non-wall creatures, Warlord is 3/3. If one of those creatures is killed during the turn, Warlord immediately becomes 2/2.

mc.name: Kird Ape
mc.oracleText: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.
mc.printedText: While controller has forests in play, Kird Ape gains +1/+2.

mc.name: Lightning Bolt
mc.oracleText: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
mc.printedText: Lightning Bolt does 3 damage to one target.

mc.name: Magnetic Mountain
mc.oracleText:
Blue creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
Blue creatures have "At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap this creature."
mc.printedText: Blue creatures do not untap as normal. During their upkeep phases, players must spend {4} for each blue creature they wish to untap. This cost must be paid in addition to any other untap cost a given blue creature may already require.

mc.name: Mana Flare
mc.oracleText: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana of that type to his or her mana pool.
mc.printedText: Whenever either player taps a land for mana, it produces 1 extra mana of the appropriate type.

mc.name: Manabarbs
mc.oracleText: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.
mc.printedText: Whenever mana is drawn from a land, Manabarbs does 1 damage to the land's controller.

mc.name: Mijae Djinn
mc.oracleText: Whenever Mijae Djinn attacks, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, remove Mijae Djinn from combat and tap it.
mc.printedText: If you choose to attack with Mijae Djinn, flip a coin immediately after attack is announced; opponent calls heads or tails while coin is in the air. If the flip ends up in opponent's favor, Mijae Djinn is tapped but does not attack.

mc.name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
mc.flavorText: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

mc.name: Orcish Artillery
mc.oracleText: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
mc.printedText: {T}: Orcish Artillery does 2 damage to any target, but it also does 3 damage to you.
mc.flavorText: In a rare display of ingenuity, the Orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most Orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

mc.name: Orcish Oriflamme
mc.oracleText: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
mc.printedText: During your attack, all of your attacking creatures gain +1/+0.

mc.name: Power Surge
mc.oracleText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Power Surge deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of untapped lands he or she controlled at the beginning of this turn.
mc.printedText: At the beginning of a player's turn, before the untap phase, the player must take a counter for each of his or her lands that is not tapped. During the player's upkeep, Power Surge does 1 damage to that player for each counter; the counters are then discarded.

mc.name: Red Elemental Blast
mc.oracleText: Choose one - Counter target blue spell; or destroy target blue permanent.
mc.printedText: Counters a blue spell being cast or destroys a blue card in play.

mc.name: Roc of Kher Ridges
mc.oracleText: Flying
mc.printedText: Flying
mc.flavorText: We encountered a valley topped with immense boulders and eerie rock formations. Suddenly one of these boulders, toppled from its perch and spread gargantuan wings, casting a shadow of darkness and sending us fleeing in terror.

mc.name: Rock Hydra
mc.oracleText:
Rock Hydra comes into play with X +1/+1 counters on it.

For each 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra, if it has a +1/+1 counter on it, remove a +1/+1 counter from it and prevent that 1 damage.

{R}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra this turn.

{R}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Rock Hydra. Play this ability only during your upkeep.
mc.printedText: Put X +1/+1 counters (heads) on Hydra. Each point of damage Hydra suffers kills one head unless controller spends {R} per head. During controller's upkeep, new heads may be grown for {R}{R}{R} apiece.

mc.name: Sedge Troll
mc.oracleText:
Sedge Troll gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Swamp.

{B}: Regenerate Sedge Troll.
mc.printedText:
{B}: Regenerates.
While controller has swamps in play, Sedge Troll gains +1/+1.
mc.flavorText: The stench in the hovel was overpowering; something loathsome was cooking. Occasionally something surfaced in the thick paste, but my host would casually push it down before I could make out what it was.

mc.name: Shatter
mc.oracleText: Destroy target artifact.
mc.printedText: Shatter destroys target artifact.

mc.name: Shatterstorm
mc.oracleText: Destroy all artifacts. They can't be regenerated.
mc.printedText: All artifacts in play are buried.
mc.flavorText: Chains of leaping fire and sizzling lightning laid waste the artificers' handiwork, sparing not a single device.

mc.name: Shivan Dragon
mc.oracleText:
Flying
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: Flying, {R}: +1/+0
mc.flavorText: While it's true most Dragons are cruel, the Shivan Dragon seems to take particular glee in the misery of others, often tormenting its victims much like a cat plays with a mouse before delivering the final blow.

mc.name: Smoke
mc.oracleText: Players can't untap more than one creature during their untap steps.
mc.printedText: Each player can only untap one creature during his or her untap phase.

mc.name: Stone Giant
mc.oracleText: {T}: Target creature you control with toughness less than Stone Giant's power gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
mc.printedText: {T}: Make one of your own creatures a flying creature until end of turn. Target creature, which must have toughness less than Stone Giant's power at the time it gains flying ability, is killed at end of turn.
mc.flavorText: What goes up, must come down.

mc.name: Stone Rain
mc.oracleText: Destroy target land.
mc.printedText: Destroys any one land.

mc.name: Tunnel
mc.oracleText: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated.
mc.printedText: Buries one wall.

mc.name: Uthden Troll
mc.oracleText: {R}: Regenerate Uthden Troll.
mc.printedText: {R}: Regenerates.
mc.flavorText:
"Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere
Oi oi oi, me small a ting is near,
Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh 'n da
hurt'll disappear."
--Traditional

mc.name: Wall of Fire
mc.oracleText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
mc.flavorText: Conjured from the bowels of hell, the fiery wall forms an impassable barrier, searing the soul of any creature attempting to pass through its terrible bursts of flame.

mc.name: Wall of Stone
mc.oracleText: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
mc.flavorText: The Earth herself lends her strength to these walls of living stone, which possess the stability of ancient mountains. These mighty bulwarks thwart ground-based troops, providing welcome relief for weary warriors who defend the land.

mc.name: Wheel of Fortune
mc.oracleText: Each player discards his or her hand and draws seven cards.
mc.printedText: All players must discard their hands and draw seven new cards.

mc.name: Animate Wall
mc.oracleText:
Enchant Wall
Enchanted Wall can attack as though it didn't have defender.
mc.printedText: Target wall can now attack. Target wall's power and toughness are unchanged by this enchantment, even if its power is 0.

mc.name: Armageddon
mc.oracleText: Destroy all lands.
mc.printedText: All lands in play are destroyed.

mc.name: Balance
mc.oracleText: Except the player who controls the fewest lands, each player sacrifices lands until all players control the same number of lands as the player who controls the fewest. Players discard cards the same way, then sacrifice creatures the same way.
mc.printedText: Whichever player has more lands in play must discard enough lands of his or her choice to equalize the number of lands both players have in play. Next, equalize the cards in hand and then creatures in play the same way. Creatures lost in this manner are considered buried.

mc.name: Benalish Hero
mc.oracleText: Banding
mc.printedText: Bands
mc.flavorText: Benalia has a complex caste system that changes with the lunar year. No matter what the season, the only caste that cannot be attained by either heredity or money is that of the hero.

mc.name: Black Ward
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from black. This effect doesn't remove Black Ward.
mc.printedText: Target creature gains protection from black.

mc.name: Blessing
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

mc.name: Blue Ward
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from blue. This effect doesn't remove Blue Ward.
mc.printedText: Target creature gains protection from blue.

mc.name: Castle
mc.oracleText: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.
mc.printedText: Your untapped creatures gain +0/+2. Attacking creatures do not get this bonus.

mc.name: Circle of Protection: Black
mc.oracleText: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
mc.printedText: {1}: Prevents all damage against you from one black source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 1 mana each time you want to prevent the damage.

mc.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
mc.oracleText: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
mc.printedText: {1}: Prevents all damage against you from one blue source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 1 mana each time you want to prevent the damage.

mc.name: Circle of Protection: Green
mc.oracleText: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
mc.printedText: {1}: Prevents all damage against you from one green source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 1 mana each time you want to prevent the damage.

mc.name: Circle of Protection: Red
mc.oracleText: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
mc.printedText: {1}: Prevents all damage against you from one red source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 1 mana each time you want to prevent the damage.

mc.name: Circle of Protection: White
mc.oracleText: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
mc.printedText: {1}: Prevents all damage against you from one white source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 1 mana each time you want to prevent the damage.

mc.name: Conversion
mc.oracleText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Conversion unless you pay {W}{W}.
All Mountains are Plains.
mc.printedText: All mountains are considered basic plains while Conversion is in play. Pay {W}{W} during upkeep or Conversion is discarded.
